channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023090134
item.description:
Report E-2023090134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As a straight truck was being offloaded at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility, it was discovered that a wrangler was leaking. The wrangler was placed on oil dry and the spill was cleaned up. An investigation of the incident revealed that inner packagings were incorrectly loaded into the wrangler container which punctured the inner liner.

item.title: Report E-2023090132
item.description:
Report E-2023090132

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: In the process of offloading a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI, an employee he clipped a 301H2 with the forklift which resulted in the container being punctured. Approximately 1 liter of waste spilled into the trailer. The spill was cleaned up and the container was overpacked.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the out bound load the drum was placed on the belt. it fell off the belt and the lid seal were damaged causing a leak. DescribePack: the lid and the rubber seal are no longer sealed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The drum was put into a hazmat tote and the into the cage.

item.title: Report E-2023090048
item.description:
Report E-2023090048

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 22, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of printer ink was damaged in a load shift and released approximately one (1) pint of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and utilized hand tools to collect all printer ink-impacted materials and the damaged pail in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report E-2023080998
item.description:
Report E-2023080998

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1193 was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from SET Environmental (SET) to remediate the impacted site. SET personnel deployed absorbents and degreaser to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. SET personnel placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into a 95-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for disposal by R+L.
